Min/Max Scaling

In min/max scaling, feature values are scaled to the new range according to the minimum and maximum values of the processed feature. In this type of scaling, the minimum value of the feature is equal to 0, the maximum value is equal to 1, and the values between the minimum and maximum are scaled proportionally according to the value of the feature. Min/Max scaling defined as

\[{x_{\min \_\max \_scaled}} = \frac{{x - {x_{\min }}}}{{{x_{\max }} - {x_{\min }}}}\]

  • \(x\) is the feature value

  • \({x_{\min }}\) is the minimum value of the feature

  • \({x_{\max }}\) is the maximum value of the feature

The result of applying the min/max scaling method to the uploaded dataset is shown in Figure 18. Min/max scaled train and test sets can be viewed by clicking “Show Training Data” to view the train data and “Show Test Data” to view the test data.
